intro: Talauma hernandezii, commonly known as the Honduras talauma, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Rubiaceae. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the tropical regions of Honduras and Nicaragua. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and produces small, clustered white flowers with a faint fragrance. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in understory layers of tropical forests. Due to its ornamental value and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
